speakers.title: Director of Event Management
speakers.bio: Kelley has over 20 years’ of event management experience with numerous high-profile companies such as Apple, Facebook, Hewlett Packard, Palm Inc. and Intel. Managing events in scores of locations around the world, she has overseen a wide array of types and sizes of events: conferences, summits, tradeshows, launch events, sponsorships, roadshows, corporate parties and meetings. No stranger to complex budgeting, Kelley has been charged with managing event budgets upwards of $12 million. Kelley’s team of highly skilled event managers are second to none, and with them, she regularly orchestrates the meticulous planning process encompassing everything from the moment a venue needs to be sourced to the very last invoice is paid. Kelley has a business degree from California Polytechnic, San Luis Obispo, with a concentration in Marketing. Since orange is Kelley’s daughter’s favorite color, she frequently uses a bright orange pen instead of red when reviewing documents because it’s “nicer.”

title: Tech Talks: Session 1
description:
Hear from the authors of the following papers:
Automating Hybrid Infrastructure with Ansible & AWX
AWS EMR Best Practices
Starfire: Starling Powered Grid Usage Dashboard
One CPU at a Time

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Automating Hybrid Infrastructure with Ansible & AWX
description: Automating ad-hoc tasks to run at-scale, in large inventories, requires achieving a delicate balance across many different dimensions - ease of use, performance, maintainability and future adoptability. We propose an Ansible AWX automation architecture that put in place the building blocks required to create an extensible and user-friendly automation workflow within our org and explore a sample use-case that was deployed. We evaluate the benefits and shortcomings of this  approach and dive deeper into the larger vision of what is possible with such systems.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: AWS EMR Best Practices
description: The Centaur team has successfully migrated on-prem grid jobs to AWS Elastic Map Reduce.  This is a discussion of the lessons learned and best practices based on our experience with AWS EMR.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Starfire: Starling Powered Grid Usage Dashboard
description: Observability is critical for both operations and developers. For grid administrators, finding jobs and users stressing the grid can be difficult when the resources are all shared. Teams use memory and CPU in shared queues, and resources like disk I/O are not tracked directly even though they can very much affect performance of other containers on the same machine. We created the Starfire Grid Project Dashboard to bring together metrics on storage, memory, CPU, and disk I/O across all the clusters into a single Yamas Horizon dashboard. Top-N allows administrators to find problematic users and jobs, and user/cluster drill-downs allow customers to see their total impact (including estimated AWS cost) and biggest jobs at a glance. Starfire was also instrumental in finding and tracking cleanup of 30PB using a few new tools, GDM, and the FrostByte archival platform.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: One CPU at a Time
description: This talk is about how we improved resource utilization across multiple Sports applications, what were the challenges, approach we took to broadly reduce our resource footprint compared to the past NFL seasons. Sports  workloads are primarily hosted on on-prem Kubernetes cluster(Omega).  We improved Sports CPU utilization and reduced resource requirement for multiple applications by doing Application Right Sizing.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Tech Talks: Session 2
description:
Hear from the authors of the following papers:
Cookies, Consent, and Transparency
Improving Brooklyn Routing with Pixie
Generic Bastion: A modern IBD-based SSH proxy
Lightweight Egress Proxy for mTLS, Athenz based backend services
IMAP Protocol Changes to Reduce Load

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Cookies, Consent, and Transparency
description:
Client-side storage (cookies, localStorage, and IndexedDBs) is an important part of the online experience. Yet it is under scrutiny due to privacy, consent, and transparency concerns. The lack of tracking has impaired our ability to share modules across systems, ensure we did not have name collisions, or check if a module still required continued support. In 2021, Yahoo launched a new client-side storage registry driven by regulatory needs and technical excellence.

Learn about the motivation behind the new registry, the registration process, and the implementation of cookie filtration at the edge servers. Yahoo now has a catalog of client-side storage by purpose, the means to generate public disclosures of our cookies, an ability to apply a cookie allowlist, and a blocklist of cookies that must be set only when we have proper user consent. We are also now able to identify in advance which storage items may be most impacted by future browser changes to client-side storage handling

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Improving Brooklyn Routing with Pixie
description: The Edge Data Network Analytics (EDNA) team collects server-side measurements to monitor performance of Yahoo users around the world. Brooklyn, Yahoo's global load balancing system, uses these measurements in addition to Anycast to choose the best site to route the traffic. In this paper we show how Pixie, our beaconing system to collect measurements of all of our points of presence, can be used to fix routing errors and improve performance in regions where current routing technique fails to find the best routable site available. We show that deploying Pixie improves the latency of roughly 20% of clients in South America by least 40 milliseconds and the latency of roughly 10% of clients in the Asia and Pacific (APAC) region by at least 11 milliseconds.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Tech Talks: Session 3
description:
Hear from the authors of the following papers:
Security Bot: Interactive Incident Triage
Reliable web push notifications for Yahoo Mail using statecharts
Personalized Content Push Notifications
Buffett: A Near Real-Time and Serverless Notification System for Finance News

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Generic Bastion: A modern IBD-based SSH proxy
description: SSH-based proxies enable engineers to access hosts located in a private or a restricted access network. However, the current on-prem proxies lack a mechanism to authorize the user access and privileges based on the SSHCA certificate principal, making it difficult to provide role-based access control (RBAC). Generic Bastion is built on the Inglourious Bastion Daemon (IBD) to provide the essential functionality. Generic bastion offers fine-grained SSH authentication by utilizing SSHCA and calypso infrastructure, and configurable authorization by utilizing Athenz. It supports SSH multiplexing and use of the headless user certificate. This enabled SSHCA team to fully automate their server side deployment in the OWS environment, as they migrated the services from legacy vault to OWS.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Security Bot: Interactive Incident Triage
description:
Based on the past Paranoids Red Team (offensive engineering) operations, the Paranoids identified multiple critical moments where, if an administrator was alerted to a change in the environment, a kill chain could be broken. To address these concerns and close identified gaps, the Paranoids introduce Security Bot. A slack bot whose sole mission is to notify and gather real-time signals from the right people just-in-time of an unusual or suspicious security event.

The bot utilizes Slack to immediately notify and interact with the end users upon a detection. This cross-functional team collaboration effort within the Paranoids greatly strengthens a detection process that previously solely relied on technical detections. It tremendously enhances the ability of the Paranoids to disrupt the cyber kill chain for the use cases it handles. In this paper, we will discuss the design and implementation of Security Bot, and several production use cases on how it is used by the Paranoids in aiding the end users to interactively triage security incidents.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Lightweight Egress Proxy for mTLS, Athenz based backend services
description:
Moving to an Athenz based backend service from the YCA base is one of the most substantial challenges for consumers who are calling these backend services. Even though Athenz role token fetching and 3way TCP+TLS handshakes are expensive and costly, they are essential processes. Therefore, each application requires a proper solution to overcome these issues.

In this paper, it details how Lightweight Egress Proxy, or LEP [1], helps reduce the overhead runtime of the TCP+TLS handshake and improves the CPU performance as well as supplying a more tolerant way to deal with bad backend services.

LEP is made to improve difficulties containing TCP+TLS handshakes and is straightforward in applying this in similar cases. This document provides examples and success stories of how properties are taking advantage of this service.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Reliable web push notifications for Yahoo Mail using statecharts
description: Yahoo Mail for the mobile web offers push notifications for new email on Android devices using the internal Rivendell platform. Subscribing to push notifications requires complex API registration and association flows. The implementation for subscription was error prone and difficult to refactor. A finite state machine was developed using XState to ensure push notifications are subscribed correctly. XState machines can be visually inspected as they run in our application. These visualizations, described as statecharts in a 1987 paper by David Hagel, provide a compact and expressive visual description of a state machine. Using statecharts in development and logging state transitions in production provided unique feedback to fix defects in error handling and logic. Switching to this new implementation increased notification DAUs from 13.9% to 17.4% and notifications received by 60% from 5MM to 8MM per day.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Tech Talks: Session 4
description:
Hear from the authors of the following papers:
Under-delivery Detection and Recommendation System in DSP
Rich Ad Format Integration: DSP and Gemini

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: IMAP Protocol Changes to Reduce Load
description: Yahoo Mail allows users to access their mailboxes from other mail providers via the IMAP-IN feature. This is achieved by using the IMAP protocol. IMAP uniquely identifies an email using MSN or UID. MSN points to the relative position of an email in a mailbox, while UID is an immutable persisted value. MSN being ephemeral cannot be persisted and has to be generated for each session. This means repeatedly scanning the metadata server and throwing away the data at the end of the session.We came up with a custom extension to paginate the mailbox using UID. This extension avoids a scan of the mailbox that was required to generate MSN. The IMAP command response was modified to send UID in place of MSN. On implementing the extension we are seeing a significant reduction in metadata system load and improved IMAP server scalability.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Personalized Content Push Notifications
description:
Push notifications is a great engagement tool for users with the content present on the Yahoo platform. This initiative expands from explicit interests or user-asked notifications to learning user’s interests in topics over time and sending personalized content-based push notifications that the users’ would be interested in.

This is a cross-systems initiative with Push Notifications Platform ( Rivendell ), Content Platform ( NCP ), Article Recommendation System & User Profile / Interests ( JARVIS ) and the various Brands ( Mobile / Web app ).

This initiative has been piloted with Taiwan SuperApp iOS and Android, Yahoo.com Homepage and has seen uplift in Notification CTR, perceived relevance and likeness to the pushes sent out.
Here we will discuss the use-case, product, engineering, UI / UX challenges faced and solutions applied.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Under-delivery Detection and Recommendation System in DSP
description: Full delivery of the advertising budget is crucial to the success of our programmatic buying platform (demand side platform, DSP). It increases revenue and the business partner’s faith in the platform. Troubleshooting in case of under-delivery is important, but oftentimes challenging due to the complexity of the system. In this paper, we present a smart solution to that by introducing an under-delivery detection and recommendation system to DSP. The system consists of two parts: backend data pipelines and UI integration. Project Midas serves as the backend data engine. It consolidates various data sources, determines the delivery status for DSP Line/Package/Campaigns, and provides insightful and actionable recommendations. The data generated by Midas empowers the Delivery Health Indicator feature on UI, which presents the clients an overview of the delivery status as well as detailed recommendations for under-delivered lines. With this feature, we were able to boost the delivery rate and reclaim around 4 million yearly revenue for DSP.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Buffett: A Near Real-Time and Serverless Notification System for Finance News
description: Buffett is a near real-time notification system for finance news articles. It selects qualified finance news articles and pushes notifications to users who are interested in the tick-ers (stock symbols) mentioned in the articles. Two machine-learned models are involved in Buffett:  (1)  news quality model and (2) user targeting model, which make Buffett much smarter. By adapting the advantages of Grid, such as Hive, Hadoop, Spark, Apache oozie, and so on, Buffett achieves the features of real-time and serverless. Our performance study shows that Buffett successfully attracts more than 17k users, which is 4.5% of Finance App DAU, to come back to Finance App. In addition, the user engaged rate and notification engaged rate of Buffett are 41% and 115% respectively higher than editor-selected notifications.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Rich Ad Format Integration: DSP and Gemini
description:
Yahoo has the objective of integrating two separate Ad systems, DSP and Gemini, into a unified platform with a goal of using the DSP as a unified entrance of ads buying. DSP provides programmatic advertising with all major ad exchanges, SSPs, and publishers, while Gemini focuses on serving ads on the Yahoo Native marketplace. Introducing well-received ad formats from Gemini to DSP is necessary.

Newly-introduced ad formats from Gemini to DSP provided more options in serving ads. Rich Ad formats (ad formats with multiple medias, assets and highly-interactive UI like Tiles Ads or 3D Ads) had high customer values, generating more than $3M per quarter in Gemini but they bring challenges to the integration, from the ui builder to the data model design. We tailored the DSP legacy design to accept the Rich Ad Formats. It helps the future integration and enables us to rapidly build brand-new Rich Ad Formats at scale so advertisers can leverage immersive, highly-interactive ad formats.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: FM2: Field-matrixed Factorization Machines for Recommender Systems
description: Click-through rate (CTR) prediction plays a critical role in recommender systems and online advertising. The data used in these applications are multi-field categorical data, where each feature belongs to one field. Field information is proved to be important and there are several works considering fields in their models. We propose a novel approach to model the field information effectively and efficiently which is a direct improvement of FwFM, and is named as Field-matrixed Factorization Machines (FmFM, or FM2). We also proposed a new explanation of FM and FwFM within the FmFM framework and compared it with the FFM. Our model supports field-specific variable dimensions of embedding vectors, which act as soft pruning. The FmFM model can also be optimized further by caching the intermediate vectors, and it only takes thousands of floating-point operations (FLOPs) to make a prediction. Our results show that it can out-perform the FFM.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Treat Our Customers In a Way They Deserve Before They Expect - Predicting Users' Next Active Time at Scale
description: We proposed an advanced system to predict the users' next activity time. This involves extensive feature engineering and efficient machine learning models. Our predictive model for user activity in the next hour achieves 100% recall and accurately predicts 4% of the users who did not come back within 1 hour. By giving 1 hour sessions, this can improve the security of the users with usability issues. In total it can improve the security of 6.79M users daily and improve 3.12M users' experience. We also did extensive study understanding the effect of short sessions. Shorter session means more frequent session refreshes and crumb error is breaking submission of data due to session refreshes. We studied the crumb error ratio on many random buckets with different period of session extensions and identified the best session extensions lengths.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Tech Talks: Session 5
description:
Hear from the authors of the following papers:
Unbiased Filtering Of Accidental Clicks in Native Advertising
Conversion-Based Dynamic-Creative-Optimization in Native Advertising
Evolution of Elide’s Templated Virtual Semantic Layer
Nonparametric Bid Shading: Auction Prices Aren’t Random - Exploiting the Deep Structure of Ad Auctions
Query Categorization for Product Search
Search Experiment Management System [XMS] Migration to Evaluate

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Unbiased Filtering Of Accidental Clicks in Native Advertising
description: In this work we focus on the challenge of predicting click-through rates (CTR) when we are aware that some of the clicks have short dwell-time and are defined as accidental clicks. In this work, we present a new approach where the positive weight of the accidental clicks is distributed among all of the negative events, based on their likelihood of causing accidental clicks, as predicted by an auxiliary model. These likelihoods are taken as the correct labels of the negative events in our training process. The modified model was tested online serving VZM native users, and provided 1.18% revenue lift over the production model.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Conversion-Based Dynamic-Creative-Optimization in Native Advertising
description: Gemini native advertising marketplace serves billions of impressions daily, to hundreds millions of unique users, and reaches a yearly revenue of over $1B. Dynamic creative optimization (DCO) is a recent Gemini product where advertisers provide several assets per each ad attribute, creating multiple combinations for each DCO ad. Here, we present a post-auction solution, where combinations are favored according to their predicted conversion rate (CVR). The predictions are provided by an auxiliary combination CVR prediction model, and used to generate combination distributions for DCO ad rendering during serving time. After demonstrating a 53% CVR lift when compared to a bucket serving combinations uniformly at random, the CVR based DCO product is now fully deployed serving all traffic.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Tech Talks: Session 6
description:
Hear from the authors of the following papers:
Identity Based Microsegmentation
A Deep and Efficient Model for LocationPrediction with Large-scale Data
The New Mobile Best Known Demographics Pipeline

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Evolution of Elide’s Templated Virtual Semantic Layer
description:
Elide is an open-source, model-driven API framework for CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) and Analytics created at Yahoo. Analytic models are created using a virtual semantic layer. The virtual semantic layer overlays a simple data model (composed of tables, metrics, and dimensions) over a more complex physical database schema. Elide's virtual semantic layer is templated, allowing the model designer to map the physical schemas to the presented data model using dynamic elements from the user's query.

In 2021, Elide added support for parameterized columns and a query optimizer. Parameterized columns (an industry first) allow thousands of discrete measures and dimensions to be simplified into a smaller, parameterized taxonomy. Query optimization, made more challenging by the dynamic nature of templates, reduced customer query latency by up to 75%. A patent filing is in progress for both the features.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Identity Based Microsegmentation
description:
Zero Trust is the company-wide security strategy which applies to many areas including network access control. Athenz has been the de-facto solution for applying the zero trust principles at the Application layer, but when it comes to the Network layer security, we rely on Security Zones and Network Access Control Lists (ACLs). YAKL local rules were implemented but that solution relied on hand-edited sets of IP addresses which is hard to maintain and keep updated.

To promote defense-in-depth, the Security Platforms & Paranoids Engineering teams created Athenz identity based Microsegmentation implemented using YAKL. With Microsegmentation we can better protect the Network traffic across Yahoo. Microsegmentation allows users to define access policies in Athenz UI using Athenz identities. These policies get translated into optimized iptables rules and installed on the end hosts with the YAKL agent. The "Minimum Viable Product" (MVP) is now available for early adopters.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Nonparametric Bid Shading: Auction Prices Aren’t Random - Exploiting the Deep Structure of Ad Auctions
description: Bid Shading has become crucial technology for winning in the highly competitive real-time auctions of Online Advertising. Most bid shading algorithms work by estimating the probability of win given bid and request attributes. To this end, there has been much speculation as to whether Log-Normal, Gamma, Beta, or other distributions, provide the best fit. In this talk, we show evidence that online auctions diverge from these classic distributions. In particular, real auctions exhibit usable structure, due to the way that humans set up campaigns and inventory floor prices. We explore the phenomenon and show some experiments where we try to increase performance.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: A Deep and Efficient Model for Location Prediction with Large-scale Data
description: In this paper, we first propose novel techniques to encode zipcodes and IP addresses to dense embeddings helping meet much more stringent latency requirements and comparable performance. Then, we feed embeddings into a deep learning model along with other various signals to predict current user location and use distance sensitive loss to optimize the model. Our model shows superior performance over current production in offline evaluations. It also provides a practical lesson on how we formalize this large-scale problem into a deep learning framework and apply on the product.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Query Categorization for Product Search
description: Product search is an important part of online shopping. In order to provide users with a satisfying search experience, we cannot rely solely on traditional web search technologies such as keyword matching. We introduce a new model for query categorization that was recently launched on Yahoo Shopping Hub and Yahoo Shops and aims to improve commercial search. The new model extends recent product and deal categorization efforts and maps search queries to GPT categories (e.g. ‘ps5’ -> ‘Video Game Consoles’, ‘dyson v10’ -> ‘Vacuums’). Though manually labelled data for this task was very limited, we were able to train the new model by leveraging query and click data of Yahoo Shopping Hub using weak supervision approaches. The new model was ramped up to GA in September following a successful bucket showing +12% improvement to query CTR.  This concluded a novel joint effort between the Inbox Commerce Research Team (HFA) and the Global Commerce team (TW), which took several months to complete.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: The New Mobile Best Known Demographics Pipeline
description: A collaboration of User Record Store (URS) and Targeting, Insights and Measurement (T++) teams, has resulted in a new Mobile Best Known Demographics (Mobile BKD) pipeline predicting gender (binary choice) and ten year age buckets based primarily on data from Fluorobenzene which is derived from incoming Flurry data. The new pipeline builds on the old Flurry Best Known Demographics by including Embeddings As A Service (EmbAAS) derived from User Activity Trails (UAT) and Metroplex App Data, and now uses TensorflowOnSpark to leverage a deep learning model.  The result is an improvement in accuracy of predictions in the test data from ~82% to ~89% (ROC-AUC) in gender and from ~32% to ~45% (simple percentage) in age bucket. This paper will review the previous system, the investigations into methods and approach for the new Mobile BKD, and discuss pertinent details to the final production system.

title: Tech Talks: Session 7

Bringing the Yahoo Ecosystem to Your Inbox
Brand-Phish: Phish Detection with Active Learning
AMP+ : Enabling payments and monetization on Mail using AMP

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Search Experiment Management System [XMS] Migration to Evaluate
description: XMS was the A/B testing platform dedicated to the Search experimentation in Yahoo. XMS was used very heavily by Search PMs to run A/B tests with various external partners like Microsoft. While XMS was supporting thousands of experiments, it was a product with a lot of legacy tech, requiring non-trivial manual effort and was running with a lot of potential business risks. Evaluate on the other hand, is built on latest tech, with experimentation as a service model and empowers all Yahoo apps and web products to run A/B tests. Approximately 3000 tests are conducted every year to test and release new features. Consolidating these two platforms created one unified ecosystem which is enabling all of Yahoo product managers run experiments in seamless manner. We present the migration of Search experimentation from XMS to Evaluate, the motivation behind this migration, the challenges we faced and overcome, and the architectural decisions taken during this migration.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Bringing the Yahoo Ecosystem to Your Inbox
description:
In the first half of 2021, we worked on bringing the “Next Gen Yahoo” (NGY) experience to the Yahoo Mail app on iOS and Android. NGY is the company-wide effort to easily share Yahoo content across different properties with small, reusable user interface (UI) modules. For example, stock tickers and charts are a core competency of Yahoo Finance. Any other property or app should be able to, with minimal effort, draw on that expertise and deliver stock charts to users.

The vision for the Yahoo Mail mobile apps was to detect when messages contained content for which we could show module views. A cross-functional team across Sports, Finance, Mail, and the Common SDK group worked together to implement and ship the feature. Both iOS and Android worked in a parallel effort. The paper covers the ModuleSDK we built to help define how modules should work, the implementations of the Sports and Finance modules, how the Mail app integrated the modules, and finally, how the feature fared in production: Did users find it helpful?
"

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Brand-Phish: Phish Detection with Active Learning
description: We improve on previous work by Chan and Pal ~\\cite{ChanPal19} and present a ML based retrospective Phish detection algorithm. The main idea behind the phish classifier is to target a subset of Phish emails that mimic known brands based on 3 checks - brand check, call for action check and domain check. The main contributions of this work are - a ML based classifier based on weakly supervised Machine Learning techniques that is further enhanced by active learning; a heuristic to check domain reputation; and robust evaluation pipelines. The call for action classifier and the domain heuristic replace the regular expression based call for action check and a static allow-list of domains presented by~\\cite{ChanPal19}. The algorithm has been in production since Q1-2021. In the past 3 months, the average catch of the retrospective filter among emails classified as not-spam by our primary spam classifier Abaca was approximately 830k emails per day. Compared to a version trained without active learning, the production version has a 34\\% lift in the number of emails caught as Phish.

title: AMP+ : Enabling payments and monetization on Mail using AMP
description: Yahoo and AOL mail represents 30%  of the US market share next to Gmail in terms of the volume and user base. It provides a massive opportunity for Yahoo!  ecosystem as it enables commercial value for both brands and users alike. We enable more than $200B in terms of receipts from commercial transactions and enable 2.4B email marketing to our user’s inbox. Our users have purchased more than $7.5B (GMV) from email links in O&O clients. Driving user engagement and value with creative and dynamic AMP (Accelerated Mobile Pages) provides a great opportunity for Yahoo! as an email operator thereby opening avenues for monetization in terms of partnerships with AMP partners and Brands. AMP enables email to behave like an application and enables one click payments from right within the email, this enables Yahoo! to play a central role in payment processing and revenue share from transactions.

title: Deep sports video understanding for broadcast sports video
description: We present a set of methods for understanding broadcast sports videos, capable of automatically producing rich time-stamped meta-data. This meta-data unlocks use-cases in video search, personalization, user experiences and automated notifications, among others. Previously, we provided a solution for temporally aligning play-by-play data to highlight reels. It showed some limitations, particularly in soccer, where the play-by-play data has low temporal resolution. That inferred: the type of camera view at each instant, important events, and the start and end time of each highlight. In particular, using a data programming approach we are able to significantly decrease manual labeling efforts.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse

Partner Client Authorization (PCA)

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: JARVIS Real-Time Personalization for In-Session Stream Ranking
description: Prior to April 2021, when users visited Yahoo.com they would see a stream of 170 news articles pre-computed by JARVIS in one batch. Now, users see a dynamic stream that learns from their clicks in real-time and updates the stream ranking on every scroll. This personalizing of the stream within a session required a fundamental re-thinking of the entire JARVIS stack, including the client interface calling JARVIS more than once, user profiles updating in real-time based on session clicks, and our serving application maintaining session state. JARVIS' shift to real-time is the culmination of a multi-year effort to accelerate personalization for all our users.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Partner Client Authorization (PCA)
description:
Today first party clients that integrate with third party SDKs / APIs cannot share user credentials easily, which means that a logged in user may need to re-authenticate via a system browser in order to complete a third party flow (e.g. betting within Sports app). In such cases, it is beneficial to leverage the already logged in user credentials to streamline the flow.

In the Sports app (i.e. first party client) that embeds the BetMGM partner SDK (i.e. third party client), BetMGM SDK enables users of the Sports app to place bets, which is a great revenue opportunity for VMG. Partner client authorization will allow the Sports app to use the stored user credentials to authorize the BetMGM client.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Speedy, Reliable, and Secure Builds for Yahoo Mail
description: The speed, reliability, and security of the Yahoo Mail web application build system was improved. Build automation goals were challenged by the large amount of small files in Git which slowed down Git clones, long tooling run times, and a new metrics-based promotion system for automated production releases with no human involvement. Screwdriver platform improvements, improved configuration, per-step retry, and Screwdriver pipeline caches were used to reduce end-to-end deployment pipeline time by 53% and increase build pass rate from 19.7% to 77.9%. Screwdriver network isolation and Volta reduce the risk of supply chain attacks like those which affected Apple, PayPal, Yelp, Shopify, and Netflix in early 2021.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Software L4 Load Balancing for Kubernetes Services
description:
In Omega, Pods handling the requests for a service are dynamic and ephemeral in nature (due to autoscale, deployment and server maintenance), hence the ip of the pod can’t be maintained static. With the frequent workload ip changes, VIP/LB must propagate the changes quickly to avoid any request failures. Currently, with A10 (hardware) Load balancer,  Servers (workloads) are static and preconfigured and also LB API’s are not optimized for dynamic updates (like addition/removal of backend) hence it is not an optimal solution for ephemeral workloads.

This paper talks about Cilium (open source software for transparently securing the network connectivity between application services deployed using Linux container management platforms like Kubernetes) and how Cilium is leveraged to operate as a North-South Loadbalancer with performance and quick workload propagation.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

Growing Mail Plus Subscriptions

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Growing Mail Plus Subscriptions
description: Yahoo Mail has a long history of premium subscriptions since 2003. In 2013, Yahoo Mail launched Mail Pro, which emphasizes exclusively on an ad-free experience. However, the subscription growth has declined after a peak in 2016. As we’ve begun to shift our monetization focus away from advertisements and towards subscription-based revenue growth, as well as to include more features with better pricing, we introduced Mail Plus in 2021, a new premium bundle with benefits and features across all platforms. This paper will cover how we designed Mail Plus from a product perspective, what features and upsells we implemented across all platforms, what optimization we have made and what exciting results we have achieved during this journey.

allowed_access_levels.name: TechPulse
allowed_access_levels.description: Virtual access to all things TechPulse

title: Supporting sFTP Delivery Mechanisms for Reports in Gemini
description:
Gemini Reporting powers analytics for Yahoo’s Native Ad Platform offering. End users and advertisers can request analytics using Gemini UI, API, or schedule reports to be delivered to them using email. Google SA360, one of Gemini’s premium advertisers, came up with a requirement to deliver these analytic reports to their sFTP Server instead of user’s emails. Gemini Reporting embarked upon a new feature support to deliver reports to any external sFTP servers of all our advertisers.

Since the destination sFTP server is external to Yahoo it opens up new avenues for smart and secure design solutions for network port operations, storing user credentials securely, transferring files securely within Yahoo network, as well as to the external network. We built an entirely new infrastructure orchestrated using ScrewDriver pipelines on AWS, which offers a demilitarized zone network. We also made sure that relevant alarms are configured for the health of AWS infrastructure.
